alert.note: Alert for Davis; Morgan; Salt Lake; Tooele; Utah; Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 1:48AM MST until February 28 at 2:30AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Weber County in northern Utah... Salt Lake County in northern Utah... Davis County in northern Utah... Southwestern Morgan County in northern Utah... Northwestern Utah County in northern Utah... Southeastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 230 AM MST * At 148 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Syracuse to 8 miles northwest of Magna to Tooele Army Depot to 6 miles northwest of Vernon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 279 and 336. Interstate 84 between mile markers 86 and 107. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 96 and 134. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Layton, Murray, Bountiful, Tooele, Farmington, Morgan, Hill Air Force Base, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Lehi, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Clearfield, Midvale and Kaysville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Davis; Morgan; Salt Lake; Tooele; Utah; Weber
